pubdate: Leaders of the  UCPN (Maoist)  had walked out from the three-party meeting held at the official residence of the Prime Minister at Baluwatar on Saturday. 2014-12-21 06:21
title: 19-party-taskforce-to-announce-fresh-stir
news:
KATHMANDU, DEC 21 - 
	The 19-party Alliance led by the  UCPN (Maoist)  has formed an 11-member taskforce to announce protest programmes, after discussion with the ruling parties—Nepali Congress and CPN-UML ended inconclusive.



Today's meeting of the alliance held at the Parliamentary Party Office of the  UCPN (Maoist)  formed the taskforce comprising Krishna Bahadur Mahara, Hridayesh Tripathi, Jitendra Narayan Dev, Prem Bahadur Singh, Gopal Dahit, Laxman Lal Karna, Bijay Sainju, Rukmini Tharu, Rani Sharma Tiwari, Ram Kumar Rai and Rajendra Shrestha.



The taskforce would propose the protest programmes on Monday and the meeting of the alliance scheduled for Monday afternoon would make the protest programmes public, said Chairman of Samajbadi Janata Party Prem Bahadur Singh.



Similarly, the meeting also decided to meet Chairman of Constituent Assembly (CA), Subas Nembang, today itself and familiarise Nembang about the discussions held in the meeting as well as to urge Nembang to send the report of the disputed issues of the constitution writing back to the Constitutional-Political Dialogue and Consensus Committee (PDCC), added Chairman Singh.



At the meeting, the  UCPN (Maoist)  shared about the talks held with NC and CPN-UML on Saturday and emphasised that there was no alternative to go for agitation. However, an agreement was reached at the Alliance to take discussions and protest ahead simultaneously.
